rows.title: Recycling organic materials to the soil is essential
keypoint_list: Recycling Organic Materials to Feed and Replinish the Soil

rows.title: Covering the soil protects it from erosion and allows more water to be stored in soils
rows.image_title_1: Soil with Good cover and drainage, LOW EROSION, more water
rows.image_title_2: Bare, crusted soil with poor infiltration, HIGH EROSION, less water for crops

rows.title: The diversity of life in the soil benefits all of us.
rows.image_title_1: How many of these have you seen in the soil?
keypoint_list: Most soil animals are not harmful and many are quite beneficial, eating pests, transforming organic matter into nutrients for plants, and bringing nitrogen from the air to feed plantsl.

rows.title: Different types of plants complement each other to benefit soils and productivity
rows.image_title_1: Crop variety;A large healthy legume nodule on the root with red colour indicating that free nitrogen is being added to the soil;Perennial and long season plants have more roots to feed the soil
keypoint_list: How many types of crops and other plants grow in your community?

rows.title: Healthy soil has crumbs (aggregates) and pores (channels) that help it to BREATHE and DRINK
rows.image_title_1: What are we looking at here?
keypoint_list: Healthy soil is not a fine powder but is made up of crumbs of various sizes, with many spaces or pores between them
